Beyond the Book

Literacy related news and fun from Suffolk Libraries.

Ten of the best scary reads for Halloween

Written by Matt Shenton · Published Oct 24, 2016

With Halloween approaching, I thought I would share ten of my favourite scary reads. From dancing skeletons falling apart to an unseen ‘monster’ who imprisons random people in the dark, the following books have truly terrified me at various points in my life. I dare you to try reading one by candlelight!

Go Beyond the Book to solve a crime!

Written by Matt Shenton · Published Oct 4, 2016

Come with us as we investigate how the scales of justice can be manipulated in a thrilling new YA book.

Go Beyond the Book to visit a drowned world!

Written by Matt Shenton · Published Sep 14, 2016

Discover a dark and flooded world where warring factions fight to survive and go 'Beyond the Book' with Francesca Armour-Chelu, author of Fenn Halflin and the Fearzero.

Go Beyond the Book with Polly Ho-Yen

Written by Matt Shenton · Published Jul 19, 2016

Come with us on a journey to tower blocks and mysterious lochs as we go 'Beyond the Book' with an author who will terrify you, yet make you feel all warm inside at the same time.

Battle of the Books

Written by Matt Shenton · Published Jul 8, 2016

Find out what happened when I attended my first ever 'Battle of the Books'. Would there be bloodshed? Would my favourite win?

Go Beyond the Book and Celebrate the 2016 Carnegie Medal

Written by Matt Shenton · Published Jun 16, 2016

The 2016 Carnegie Medal will be announced on Monday 20 June. To celebrate, go Beyond the Book with the 2015 winner Tanya Landman!

Running a Reading Hack Group - Week 6

Written by Matt Shenton · Published May 20, 2016

In week 6 of our ‘Reading Hack’ sessions, the Beccles Book Bunnies ‘Hack’ Minecraft to design a library of the future and take over the issues counter in Beccles library.

Running a Reading Hack Group - Week 5

Written by Matt Shenton · Published May 12, 2016

In week 5 of our ‘Reading Hack’ sessions, the Beccles Book Bunnies 'Hack' poetry in two ways and create some beautiful seaside imagery.

Running a Reading Hack Group - Week 4

Written by Matt Shenton · Published May 5, 2016

In week 4 of our 'Reading Hack' sessions, the Beccles Book Bunnies train to be librarians and start to plan their own Hacks. What would Percy Jackson like on his pizza...?

Come 'Beyond the Beetle' with us!

Written by Matt Shenton · Published May 3, 2016

Come ‘Beyond the Book’ and meet Darkus and Baxter in the amazing Beetle Boy by M.G. Leonard. Warning: contains a bucket load of laughs and amazing beetles!

Running a Reading Hack Group - Week 3

Written by Matt Shenton · Published Apr 28, 2016

In week 3 of our 'Reading Hack' sessions, the Beccles Book Bunnies 'Hack' books and green screen technology. Find out how they are transported into bookish worlds.

Running a Reading Hack Group - Week 2

Written by Matt Shenton · Published Apr 21, 2016

In part 2 of our blog series about setting up a Reading Hack group, our 'Beccles Book Bunnies' group create online accounts and Hack a popular card game.

Running a Reading Hack Group - Week 1

Written by Matt Shenton · Published Apr 18, 2016

Are you interested in starting a Reading Hack group but don't know where to start? Find out how our new Reading Hack group the 'Beccles Book Bunnies' get on each week.

Written by Matt Shenton · Published Mar 24, 2016

Go ‘Beyond the Book’ with a stunning debut novel

Written by Matt Shenton · Published Mar 2, 2016

About

My name is Matt Shenton and I am working for Suffolk Libraries as a dedicated ‘Literacy Ambassador’ for the next year. My role is to work with schools, statutory and voluntary organisations and other interested parties to promote reading for pleasure and the importance of literacy to young people and their families in Suffolk.
